Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\db\Transaction

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\db\Transaction » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
Transaction represents a DB transaction.

It is usually created by calling yii\db\Connection::beginTransaction().

The following code is a typical example of using transactions (note that some DBMS may not support transactions):

$transaction = $connection->beginTransaction();
try {
    $connection->createCommand($sql1)->execute();
    $connection->createCommand($sql2)->execute();
    //.... other SQL executions
    $transaction->commit();
} catch(Exception $e) {
    $transaction->rollback();
}

Property Details

$db property
yii\db\Connection $db = null

The database connection that this transaction is associated with.

$isActive property read-only
boolean getIsActive( )

whether this transaction is active. Only an active transaction can commit() or rollback().

Method Details

getIsActive() method
boolean getIsActive( )
return boolean whether this transaction is active. Only an active transaction can commit() or rollback().

Returns a value indicating whether this transaction is active.

begin() method
void begin( )
throws yii\base\InvalidConfigException if \yii\db\connection is null

Begins a transaction.

commit() method
void commit( )
throws yii\db\Exception if the transaction or the DB connection is not active.

Commits a transaction.

rollback() method

throws yii\db\Exception if the transaction or the DB connection is not active.
